CTASection.content: Hi, I'm Raúl! I focus on creating clean, responsive and functional web apps.

paragraph.text: I started studying web development in 2019 on my own with the help of The Odin Project.
Learning how to set up a development environment using Ubuntu, how to work with Git with GitHub, then HTML and CSS.

paragraph.subtitle: A formal education
paragraph.text: I enrolled in Acámica’s Full Stack Web Development program in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Where I improved my HTML and CSS skills and learned JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, and working with relational and non-relational databases such as MySQL and MongoDB.
In September 2020 I completed the Acámica program, I added features and made improvements to projects I’d started and also started learning React.js on my own.

paragraph.subtitle: Thereafter
paragraph.text: I continue to study and to build projects that allow me to learn new technologies and to sharpen my development skills.
Currently I find myself looking for my first experience in the industry to work alongside a team and therefore be able to learn even more from them.

projects.name: Personal website
projects.summary: The website you're currently seeing! Hope you like it. In this project I used React, functional components, Hooks, Context API, Framer Motion and Tailwind CSS.

projects.name: GifOS
projects.summary: It's a web app that allows the user to make their own GIFs, search for their favourite ones and get recommendations. I used the GIPHY API and the RecordRTC library.

projects.name: E-Learning Platform
projects.summary: A markup project for an E-learning platform offering several courses, I used HTML, CSS (with SASS as preprocessor) and Vanilla JavaScript.

projects.name: Podcast Channel
projects.summary: Markup for a podcasts website, coded using HTML and CSS.

footerSection.content: Made with React.js, TailwindCSS and a lot of ❤
